page.title: 01THE RIVER MEDWAY AT YALDING
page.content: THE RIVER MEDWAY IS MAINLY USED FOR FISHING AND CRUISING IN THE WAY OF RECREATION. THERE ARE SOME CARAVANS BEYOND THE RIVER WHICH ARE USED BY PEOPLE WHO COME FROM THE TOWNS FOR A WEEKEND IN THE COUNTRY. THERE IS AN UNUSED LOCK WHICH WAS MADE OBSOLETE WHEN THE RIVER STOPPED BEING USED BY BARGES.THE GATES HAVE BEEN TAKEN OUT FROM THE LOCK. ON ONE BANK THERE IS A FIELD WHICH IS USED FOR CLAY-PIGEON SHOOTING. IT IS OWNED BY I.C.I. THE RIVER IS VERY BUSY AT WEEKENDS AS TOURISTS COME TO IT. THE PUBLIC HOUSE,WHICH IS VERY POPULAR WITH THE VISITORS IS CALLED "THE ANCHOR".
